data.title: Resentment has mounted so much in South Korea against what has come to be known as "gabjil", high-handedness by the rich and powerful, that parliamentarians are proposing legislation to punish some of the worst abuses.
ISIS in Libya releases a video of beheading 21 Egyptian Christians.
Aggressive new HIV strain detected in Cuba; it progresses into AIDS so fast that treatment with antiretroviral drugs may come too late
A hacking ring has stolen up to $1 billion from banks around the world in what would be one of the biggest banking breaches known

U.S. Drops to 49th in World Press Freedom Rankings, Worst Since Obama Became President: The countries immediately ahead of the U.S. are Malta, Niger, Burkino Faso, El Salvador, Tonga, Chile and Botswana
Bill Clinton Apologizes To Mexico For War On Drugs

Inside the ISIS plot to attack the heart of Europe -Wiretaps of phone conversations and listening devices indicated the cell members were in the final stages of preparing a major terrorist attack in Belgium
Copenhagen shootings: Police kill 'gunman' after two attacks
Braunschweig Carnival parade canceled over 'Islamist' terror alert
